Instruction: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease cookie sheets and the outsides of four inverted 6-ounce custard cups.
In a separate bowl, cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition, then stir in vanilla.

Bake in the preheated oven for 8 to 10 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Bake in the preheated oven until the edges of the cookies turn golden brown, about 5 to 6 minutes. Take the baking sheets out of the oven and let them cool for 1 minute. Use a spatula to lift the cookies off the baking sheet and place each one onto an inverted custard cup. Let the cookies cool while you bake the remaining batter in batches.
